activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#14204
activity.text:
Hi Team,
I would like to work on this issue.

**Proposed Solution :**

Implement a persistent global filter state so applied filters remain active across modules until manually cleared or on logout.
- Use a shared store (Zustand/Redux/Context) and persist filters in sessionStorage.
- On navigation or reload, auto-hydrate filters from the store.
- Add a unified `Clear Filters` option to reset globally.

ETA : 2 days

- Test across browsers for alignment and print accuracy.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#13894
activity.text:
> Does doing this make sense in context? aria tags are used for assistive technologies - just setting them to undefined is not the solution.

Hi @Jacobjeevan,
Thanks for the feedback. You’re right — setting `aria-describedby` to `undefined` directly isn’t the right fix.

Updated approach:
- I’ll ensure DialogContent always receives a valid accessible description when required.
- If no description is provided, I’ll conditionally omit the `aria-describedby` prop altogether instead of setting it to `undefined`.
- This prevents the warning while keeping accessibility intact.

ETA : 1 day
